author: J14T14
title: "Crazy Action Contraptions," Should LEGO make more of these?
review:
I got this set at my middle school book fare. I was interested in it since it was cheap enough for me to buy at the time and it wat LEGO. It was also the first time that I got the 40-tooth gears so I was interested to see what it was all about.

The set consists of 112 parts according to Bricklink. Depending on the book you buy, some of the parts that should be black will be dark-gray and some parts that should be light-gray will be black, so expect some variation if you pick this up (Bricklink also says that this book came out in 2008 while Brickset says that it came out in 2010, so there is some conflicting information). There are also some rubber bands included and a couple of o-rings for the larger tires. The rubber bands do snap relatively easily compared to other rubber bands so be carful when using them.

Al the builds are unique and fun to build. my personal favorites are the main car shown on the front of the book, the noise maker, and the grabber arm. There are a total of 16 builds that you can make and the instructions are included in the book. Following the true spirit of LEGO, the book also encourages you to create your own contraptions using the included pieces.

Overall this is a fun little book that also comes with come fun parts and I think that LEGO should make more books like this in the future. Kids should love it and adults may also enjoy the neat little builds. I have seen these still being sold in some stores, so if you see one you should pick it up and give it a try.
